Legal_Issue: Availability of declaratory relief via action versus judicial review
Procedural_Context: Stay of removal orders pending judicial review
Basis_of_Claim: Removal orders violate Charter and Geneva Conventions Act
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Judicial review is the exclusive avenue for seeking declaratory relief under s. 18(3)
Application_Error: Applicants attempted to seek declaratory relief through an action instead of judicial review
Review_Outcome: Applications struck; applicants must proceed by judicial review
Legal_Standard: Declaratory relief under s. 18(3) requires judicial review
Application_Factor: Nature of relief sought determines proper procedural vehicle
Decision_Outcome: Stay of removal granted pending judicial review
Decision_Review_Issue: Proper procedure for seeking declaratory relief in immigration matters
Outcome_of_Review: Judicial review confirmed as required process
Cause_of_Refusal: Improper use of action for declaratory relief
Procedural_Fairness: Stay granted to allow proper judicial review
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Charter and Geneva Conventions Act arguments raised
Jurisdictional_Focus: Federal immigration law and court jurisdiction
Procedural_Issue: Use of action vs. application for judicial review
